Authors: So I.G., Ardianto R.M., Mursitama T.N., Aryanto R., Setiadi N.J.
Title: Enhancing bank reputation by centralizing bank debtor information system
Source title: WIT Transactions on Information and Communication Technologies
Authors with affiliations: So, I.G., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Ardianto, R.M., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Mursitama, T.N., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Aryanto, R., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Setiadi, N.J., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Indonesia's commercial banks are required to report the debtor data maintained to Bank Indonesia as central bank each month. Now, the reporting process is done manually by relying on one officer in each branch because the system and the data have not been integrated, also the network connection to Bank Indonesia are still using dial-up connections with low bandwidth and sometimes problematic. Therefore, this study aims to provide information system solutions in the form of debtor information system (SID) design integrated, automated, and able to cope network connection problems with Bank Indonesia. The research methodology used is to conduct interviews and analyze internal and external factors that affect the process of data reporting debtors. Then do the comparison with the literature review to design SID automation. The design of using use case diagrams, sequence diagrams, and activity diagrams with interface SID automation as output. The design of SID automation is generating the reporting process of debtor data integrated, automated, and uses direct line to Bank Indonesia. (RMA). © 2014 WIT Press.
Author Keywords: Automation; Bank reputation; Integration; Network; System
Index Keywords: Design; Information systems; Integration; Networks (circuits); Activity diagram; Bank reputation; Internal and external factors; Literature reviews; Network connection; Research methodologies; Sequence diagrams; System; Automation
